channel.title: Korg Minilogue hacking
channel.description: Hi! Here is a interesting article on how to control Minilogue parameters with Max. It would be cool to do it with Axoloti! https://carillonaudio.wordpress.com/2016/10/23/who-needs-a-modular-i-have-a-korg-minilogue/

item.title: Korg Minilogue hacking
item.dc:creator: @adnauseam Jordan
item.description:
@adnauseam wrote:

While I wouldn't call this Hacking I would call this a clever use of built-in features of the MIDI protocol

You'll find that although MIDI CC's are conveniently there for you that their 7-bit resolution (only 127 discrete values are available!) may be a limiting factor. Some synths will be made nicely to prevent users from hearing stepping when the CC value changes while lots won't, too. Not sure about the Minilogue.

Read full topic

item.title: Korg Minilogue hacking
item.dc:creator: @Blindsmyth Simon
item.description:
@Blindsmyth wrote:

I have a pigtronix echolution here wich is fully contrallbe via midi too.

I tried modulating some parameters with lfos and envelopes but eventually I was not really satisfied, all seemed a bit laggy.

But I don't know if that was the problem of my pedal or midi in general.

Read full topic

Who needs a modular? I have a Korg Minilogue
